intro: Randia physophylla, commonly known as the broadleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal by wind or animals.
